text: I have this hooked to a Sears Shop Wet/Dry Vacuum.  As others have noted, the attachment size is a little "non-standard", probably due to the fact that the hose fits over the tools instead of sliding in them.  Nonetheless, the hose and swivel are easy to use and the material makes for very efficient pickup.  I also like the claw and crevice nozzle.  They are a bit small for small spaces in my small car, but they are great for going over floors, seats, and jobsite pickup.  Definitely recommended over the stock hose that comes with most shop & wet/dry vacs.

Sturdy with an adjustable mouth and blade tilt.Understand you will need to prep this before use. The sole is not precision ground but machine rough, so you will need a granite block and sandpaper or a set of flat block diamond hones. Once you have your sole (and sides) honed and flat you will need to sharpen the blade. There are several jigs and sharpening tools to assist in this. After all is done apply an anti-rust agent such as wood wax or Boeshield.Once prep'd this is a great plane.

I picked this game up at a store because it was on sale.  Got home and read reviews...almost returned it.  Glad I didn't because it actually works very well for my kids.  My daughter (4) and son (2 1/2) both love it and can always make a "basket" within about 4 tries.  My kids were actually better at it than my husband and myself!  Granted, we have to center the doggy for them so they're lined up to flip the ants, but I don't mind that.  Definitely wasn't too difficult for them.

I purchased this game to be used during a trip with my granddaughters ages 6 and 8.  They loved the game so much that one of them asked that I purchase another one just for them for their birthday.  It is a great tool to assist them in broadening their vocabulary and spelling skills while enjoying the competition of a game. It is easy to play and understand.  Melissa and Doug have designed a visibly appealing and durable product with all parts attached to the one board eliminating the chance of losing pieces.

If you have not already noticed, Diablo is easily located within Dungeons and Dragons. This is actually a benefit for Diablo, since it has very little story going on. This RPG/action hybrid is nice and it's multiplayer community is huge. Too bad there are millions of cheaters. Just be legit and everyone else will catch on. The game offers lots of fun. Not many complaints though. They are really your choice as to if they're bad or good. Get the game if you want. Not a wasted "money".

Dino Crisis is a great game -- lots of excitement, suspense, and action.  It doesn't fail there.  I beat it in four days (seven hours playing time), though, so definitely rent it first.Some of the voice acting is weak,  but it's not the worst out there.  The story will keep you interested, as  will the battles with the enemy dinosaurs.  An added plus is the decisions  you must make at key points in the story, but even this (and the different  costumes) isn't enough to give the game the replay value it needs to make  it a 5-star game.

As others have pointed out, the attachment size is a bit "unusual," probably because the hose fits over the tools rather than sliding into them. Nevertheless, the hose and swivel are easy to use and the material provides a very efficient pick-up. I also like the claw and crevice nozzle. They are a bit small for small spaces in my small car, but are great for crossing floors, seats and pick-up sites. Definitely recommended compared to the standard hose that comes with most store & wet / dry vacuum cleaners.

The sole is not precision ground, but mechanically rough, so you need a granite block and sandpaper or a set of flat diamond stones. Once you have your sole (and the sides) polished and flat, you need to sharpen the blade. There are several jigs and sharpening tools to help with this. Finally, a rust inhibitor such as wood wax or boeshield.Once prep'd is applied, this is a great plane.

I picked up this game in a shop because it was for sale. I came home and read reviews... I almost gave it back. Good thing I didn't do it because it actually works very well for my kids. My daughter (4) and son (2 1 / 2) both love it and can always make a "basket" in about 4 attempts. My kids were actually better at it than my husband and I! Admittedly, we have to center the pooch for them to queue up to turn the ants around, but I don't mind. In any case, it wasn't too difficult for them.

I bought this game to use during a trip with my granddaughters aged 6 and 8. They loved the game so much that one of them asked me to buy another just for them for their birthday. It's a great tool to help them expand their vocabulary and spelling skills while enjoying the competition of a game. It's easy to play and understand. Melissa and Doug have designed a visually appealing and durable product where all the pieces are attached to one board, putting you in danger of losing parts.

This is actually an advantage for Diablo, because it has very little story. This role-playing / action hybrid is nice and its multiplayer community is huge. Too bad there are millions of scammers. Just be legitimate and everyone else will prevail. The game offers lots of fun. However, there are not many complaints. They are really your choice whether they are bad or good. Get the game if you want. No wasted "money."

Dino Crisis is a great game - full of suspense, excitement and action. It doesn't fail there. I've beaten it in four days (seven hours of play), so definitely rent it first. Some of the chanting is weak, but it's not the worst out there. You'll continue to be interested in the story, as will the battles with the enemy dinosaurs. An added bonus are the choices you have to make at key points in the story, but even that (and the different costumes) aren't enough to give the game the repetition value it needs to make it a 5-star game.
